title: Evidence-Based Pedagogy Workshop for Integrating Biomedical Engineering Curricula

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of engineering and life sciences, and basic instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Learners (instructors) participate to strengthen their capacity to design educational curricula reflecting the interdisciplinary nature of biomedical engineering. Emphasis is placed on bridging the gap between education and practice through real-world project development.

learning_goals: Participants can design one educational module incorporating biomedical engineering practice cases using evidence-based teaching methods.
Participants can explain three or more instructional strategies for integrating multidisciplinary knowledge.
Participants can develop project-based assessment tools to measure learner performance with quantifiable metrics.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
